Generation I.Red: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
Generation I.Yellow: The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.
Generation I.Stadium: Even the newborns have flaming tails. Unfamiliar with fire, babies are said to accidentally burn themselves.

Generation II.Gold: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life force. If it is weak, the flame also burns weakly.
Generation II.Silver: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander 's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.
Generation II.Crystal: If it's healthy, the flame on the tip of its tail will burn vigorously, even if it gets a bit wet.
Generation II.Stadium 2: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life force. If it is weak, the flame also burns weakly. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) The flame on its tail indicates Charmander 's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pok é mon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.
Generation III.Sapphire: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pok é mon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.
Generation III.Emerald: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is happy, and blazes when it is enraged.
Generation III.FireRed: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.

Generation IV.Diamond: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.
Generation IV.Pearl: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.
Generation IV.Platinum: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.
Generation IV.HeartGold: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life force. If it is weak, the flame also burns weakly.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander 's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.

Generation V.Black: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.
Generation V.White: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.
Generation V.Black 2: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.
Generation V.White 2: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

Generation VI.X: The flame on its tail indicates Charmander's life force. If it is healthy, the flame burns brightly.
Generation VI.Y: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.

Generation VIII.Sword: It has a preference for hot things. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail.
Generation VIII.Shield: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If the Pokémon is healthy, its tail burns intensely.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If the Pokémon is healthy, its tail burns intensely.

Generation IX.Scarlet: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life-force. If Charmander is weak, the flame also burns weakly.
Generation IX.Violet: If Charmander is healthy, the flame on the tip of its tail will burn vigorously and won’t go out even if it gets a bit wet.

Generation I.Red: First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town
Generation I.Blue: First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town
Generation I.Blue (Japan): First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town
Generation I.Yellow: Received from a boy on Route 24

Generation III.LeafGreen: First partner Pokémon from Professor Oak in Pallet Town

Generation IV.HeartGold: Received from Professor Oak in Pallet Town after defeating Red
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Received from Professor Oak in Pallet Town after defeating Red

Generation VI.X: Received from Professor Sycamore in Lumiose City after defeating him
Generation VI.Y: Received from Professor Sycamore in Lumiose City after defeating him

Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Route 3 , Route 4 , Rock Tunnel Route 24 ( Only one )

Generation VIII.Sword: Received from Leon at his house in Postwick after becoming Champion ( Gigantamax Factor ) Hammerlocke Hills , Lake of Outrage ( Max Raid Battle )
